name: aws-network-firewall
label: AWS Network Firewall
description: AWS Network Firewall is a managed service that makes it easy to deploy essential network protections for all of your Amazon Virtual Private Clouds (VPCs). Network Firewall is a stateful, managed, network firewall and intrusion detection and prevention service. This Connector automated operations such as retrieving create, update and delete operation in AWS Network firewall.

fields.title: Configuration Type
fields.name: config_type
fields.description: Select configuration type that is how you want to provide credentials.

IAM Role.title: AWS Instance IAM Role
IAM Role.name: aws_iam_role
IAM Role.tooltip: IAM Role of your AWS instance to access AWS services.
IAM Role.description: IAM Role of your AWS instance to access AWS services.

Access Credentials.title: AWS Region
Access Credentials.name: aws_region
Access Credentials.tooltip: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.
Access Credentials.description: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.

Access Credentials.title: AWS Access Key ID
Access Credentials.name: aws_access_key
Access Credentials.tooltip: ID of the AWS Access Key to access AWS services.
Access Credentials.description: ID of the AWS Access Key to access AWS services.

Access Credentials.title: AWS Secret Access Key
Access Credentials.name: aws_secret_access_key
Access Credentials.tooltip: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services.
Access Credentials.description: Key of the AWS Secret Access to access AWS services.

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.name: verify_ssl
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not.By default, this option is set as True.

operations.title: Get Associate Firewall Policy
operations.description: Retrieves the firewall policy associated with the firewall. A firewall policy defines how to monitor and manage your VPC network traffic, using a collection of inspection rule groups and other settings. Each firewall requires one firewall policy association, and you can use the same firewall policy for multiple firewalls.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Enable to assume a role
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role. Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the Configuration Type. If you have specified Access Credentials as the Configuration Type, then this parameter is optional.

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.
true.description: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Firewall Policy ARN
parameters.name: FirewallPolicyArn
parameters.tooltip: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the firewall policy.
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the firewall policy.

parameters.title: Firewall ARN
parameters.name: FirewallArn
parameters.tooltip: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the firewall. You must specify the ARN of the firewall or the name of the firewall, or you can specify both the name and the ARN.
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the firewall. You must specify the ARN of the firewall or the name of the firewall, or you can specify both the name and the ARN.

parameters.title: Firewall Name
parameters.name: FirewallName
parameters.tooltip: The descriptive name of the firewall. You cannot change the name of a firewall after its creation. You must specify the ARN of the firewall or the name of the firewall, or you can specify both the name and the ARN.
parameters.description: The descriptive name of the firewall. You cannot change the name of a firewall after its creation. You must specify the ARN of the firewall or the name of the firewall, or you can specify both the name and the ARN.

parameters.title: Update Token
parameters.name: UpdateToken
parameters.tooltip: An optional token that you can use for optimistic locking. AWS Network Firewall returns a token to your requests that access the firewall. The token marks the state of the firewall resource at the time of the request.
parameters.description: An optional token that you can use for optimistic locking. AWS Network Firewall returns a token to your requests that access the firewall. The token marks the state of the firewall resource at the time of the request.

operations.title: Get Associate Subnets
operations.description: Retrieves the specified subnets in the Amazon VPC that are associated with the firewall. You can specify one subnet for each of the Availability Zones that the VPC spans. This request creates an AWS Network Firewall firewall endpoint in each of the subnets. To enable the firewall's protections, you must also modify the VPC's route tables for each subnet's Availability Zone, which redirects the traffic that is coming into and going out of the zone through the firewall endpoint.

parameters.title: Next Token
parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.tooltip: When you request a list of objects with a MaxResults setting, if the number of objects that are still available for retrieval exceeds the maximum you requested, AWS Network Firewall returns a NextToken value in the response. To retrieve the next batch of objects, use the token returned from the prior request in your next request.

To retrieve the next batch of objects, use the token returned from the prior request in your next request.

operations.title: Create Firewall
operations.description: Creates a Firewall and accompanying Firewall Status for a VPC on AWS Network Firewall. The firewall defines the configuration settings for the firewall created on AWS Network Firewall. The settings that you can define at creation include the firewall policy, the subnets in your VPC to use for the firewall endpoints, and any tags that are attached to the firewall AWS resource.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to assume a role. Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the Configuration Type. If you have specified Access Credentials as the Configuration Type, then this parameter is optional.
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role. Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the Configuration Type. If you have specified Access Credentials as the Configuration Type, then this parameter is optional. If you select this option, then you must specify the following parameters:

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.
true.description: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Firewall Name
parameters.name: FirewallName
parameters.description: The descriptive name of the firewall. You cannot change the name of a firewall after its creation.

parameters.title: Firewall Policy ARN
parameters.name: FirewallPolicyArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the firewall policy you want to use for the firewall that you are creating on AWS Network Firewall.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: (Optional) A description of the firewall that you are creating on AWS Network Firewall.

parameters.title: Delete Protection
parameters.name: DeleteProtection
parameters.tooltip: A flag indicating whether it is possible to delete the firewall. A setting of TRUE (checked) indicates that the firewall is protected against deletion. Use this setting to protect against accidentally deleting a firewall that is in use. When you create a firewall, the operation initializes this flag to TRUE.
parameters.description: A flag indicating whether it is possible to delete the firewall. A setting of TRUE (checked) indicates that the firewall is protected against deletion. Use this setting to protect against accidentally deleting a firewall that is in use. When you create a firewall, the operation initializes this flag to TRUE.

parameters.title: Firewall Policy Change Protection
parameters.name: FirewallPolicyChangeProtection
parameters.description: A setting indicating whether the firewall is protected against a change to the firewall policy association. Use this setting to protect against accidentally modifying the firewall policy for a firewall that is in use. When you create a firewall, the operation initializes this setting to TRUE (checked).
parameters.tooltip: A setting indicating whether the firewall is protected against a change to the firewall policy association. Use this setting to protect against accidentally modifying the firewall policy for a firewall that is in use. When you create a firewall, the operation initializes this setting to TRUE (checked).

parameters.title: Subnet Change Protection
parameters.name: SubnetChangeProtection
parameters.description: A setting indicating whether the firewall is protected against changes to the subnet associations. Use this setting to protect against accidentally modifying the subnet associations for a firewall that is in use. When you create a firewall, the operation initializes this setting to TRUE (checked).
parameters.tooltip: A setting indicating whether the firewall is protected against changes to the subnet associations. Use this setting to protect against accidentally modifying the subnet associations for a firewall that is in use. When you create a firewall, the operation initializes this setting to TRUE (checked).

parameters.title: SubnetIDs
parameters.name: SubnetMappings
parameters.tooltip: The IDs of the subnets that you want to associate with the firewall that you are creating on the AWS Network Firewall. These will be the public subnets that will be used for your firewall on AWS Network Firewall. Each subnet must belong to a different Availability Zone in the VPC. AWS Network Firewall creates a firewall endpoint in each subnet.
parameters.description: The IDs of the subnets that you want to associate with the firewall that you are creating on the AWS Network Firewall. These will be the public subnets that will be used for your firewall on AWS Network Firewall. Each subnet must belong to a different Availability Zone in the VPC. AWS Network Firewall creates a firewall endpoint in each subnet.

parameters.title: VPC ID
parameters.name: VpcId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the VPC where AWS Network Firewall should create the firewall.
parameters.tooltip: The unique identifier of the VPC where AWS Network Firewall should create the firewall.

parameters.title: Tags
parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: (Optional) The CSV list of the tags (key:value pairs) to associate with the resource. Note: The minimum number of items that are supported in an array is 1 and the maximum number of items that are supported in an array is 200.
parameters.tooltip: The CSV list of the tags (key:value pairs) to associate with the resource. Note: The minimum number of items that are supported in an array is 1 and the maximum number of items that are supported in an array is 200.

operations.title: Create Firewall Policy
operations.description: Creates the firewall policy, according to the specifications, for a firewall. A firewall policy on AWS Network Firewall defines the behavior of a firewall, in a collection of stateless and stateful rule groups and other settings. You can use one firewall policy for multiple firewalls.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to assume a role. Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the Configuration Type. If you have specified Access Credentials as the Configuration Type, then this parameter is optional.
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role. Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the Configuration Type. If you have specified Access Credentials as the Configuration Type, then this parameter is optional. If you select this option, then you must specify the following parameters:

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.
true.description: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Firewall Policy Name
parameters.name: FirewallPolicyName
parameters.description: The descriptive name of the firewall policy. You cannot change the name of a firewall policy after its creation.

parameters.title: Firewall Policy
parameters.name: firewall_policy_json
parameters.tooltip: A JSON string of the rule groups and policy actions to use in the firewall policy.
parameters.description: A JSON string of the rule groups and policy actions to use in the firewall policy.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: (Optional) A description of the firewall policy that you are creating on AWS Network Firewall.

parameters.title: Tags
parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: (Optional) The CSV list of the tags (key:value pairs) to associate with the resource. You can define any key:value pair. Typically, the tag key represents a category (such as "environment") and the tag value represents a specific value within that category (such as "test," "development," or "production"). You can add a maximum of 50 tags to each AWS resource.
parameters.tooltip: The CSV list of the tags (key:value pairs) to associate with the resource. You can define any key:value pair. Typically, the tag key represents a category (such as "environment") and the tag value represents a specific value within that category (such as "test," "development," or "production"). You can add a maximum of 50 tags to each AWS resource.

operations.title: Create Rule Group
operations.description: Creates a specific rule group that can be stateless or stateful and which includes the rules for network traffic inspection, capacity settings, and tags.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to assume a role. Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the Configuration Type. If you have specified Access Credentials as the Configuration Type, then this parameter is optional.
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role. Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the Configuration Type. If you have specified Access Credentials as the Configuration Type, then this parameter is optional. If you select this option, then you must specify the following parameters:

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.
true.description: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Rule Group Name
parameters.name: rule_group_name
parameters.tooltip: Specify the name of the rule group that you want to create in AWS Network Firewall.
parameters.description: Specify the name of the rule group that you want to create in AWS Network Firewall.

parameters.title: Setting Type
parameters.name: setting_type
parameters.tooltip: Provide either Rule Group Setting or a Rules Setting. If you choose "Rule Group Setting", then you must specify the JSON object that defines the rule group rules. If you choose "Rules Setting", then you need to provide a string containing stateful rule group rules specifications in Suricata flat format, with one rule per line. Use this to import your existing Suricata compatible rule groups.
parameters.description: Provide either Rule Group Setting or a Rules Setting. If you choose "Rule Group Setting", then you must specify the JSON object that defines the rule group rules. If you choose "Rules Setting", then you need to provide a string containing stateful rule group rules specifications in Suricata flat format, with one rule per line. Use this to import your existing Suricata compatible rule groups.

Rule Group Setting.title: Rule Group
Rule Group Setting.name: rule_group
Rule Group Setting.tooltip: If you choose 'Rule Group Setting', then in the Rule Group field, specify a JSON object that defines the rules of the rule group rules.
Rule Group Setting.description: If you choose 'Rule Group Setting', then in the Rule Group field, specify a JSON object that defines the rules of the rule group rules.

Rules Setting.title: Rules
Rules Setting.name: rules
Rules Setting.tooltip: If you choose 'Rule Setting', then in the Rules field, specify a string that contains stateful rule group rules specifications in a Suricata flat format, with one rule per line. Use this to import your existing Suricata compatible rule groups.
Rules Setting.description: If you choose 'Rule Setting', then in the Rules field, specify a string that contains stateful rule group rules specifications in a Suricata flat format, with one rule per line. Use this to import your existing Suricata compatible rule groups.

parameters.title: Type
parameters.name: type
parameters.tooltip: Select the type of rule group; you can choose between STATELESS OR STATEFUL. If the rule group is stateless, it contains stateless rules. If it is stateful, it contains stateful rules.
parameters.description: Select the type of rule group; you can choose between STATELESS OR STATEFUL. If the rule group is stateless, it contains stateless rules. If it is stateful, it contains stateful rules.

parameters.title: Capacity
parameters.name: capacity
parameters.tooltip: The maximum operating resources that can be used by this rule group. The capacity of the rule group is fixed at its creation. When you update a rule group, you are limited to this capacity. When you reference a rule group from a firewall policy, AWS Network Firewall reserves this capacity for the rule group.
parameters.description: The maximum operating resources that can be used by this rule group. The capacity of the rule group is fixed at its creation. When you update a rule group, you are limited to this capacity. When you reference a rule group from a firewall policy, AWS Network Firewall reserves this capacity for the rule group.

parameters.title: Description
parameters.name: description
parameters.tooltip: A description of the rule group that you are creating on AWS Network Firewall.
parameters.description: (Optional) A description of the rule group that you are creating on AWS Network Firewall.

parameters.title: Tags
parameters.name: tags
parameters.tooltip: An array of tag objects to associate with the resource. Note: The minimum number of items that are supported in an array is 1 and the maximum number of items that are supported in an array is 200.
parameters.description: An array of tag objects to associate with the resource. Note: The minimum number of items that are supported in an array is 1 and the maximum number of items that are supported in an array is 200.

operations.title: Describe Firewall
operations.description: Returns the data objects for the specified firewall from AWS Network Firewall.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to assume a role. Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the Configuration Type. If you have specified Access Credentials as the Configuration Type, then this parameter is optional.
parameters.description: Select this option to assume a role. Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the Configuration Type. If you have specified Access Credentials as the Configuration Type, then this parameter is optional. If you select this option, then you must specify the following parameters:

true.title: AWS Region
true.name: aws_region
true.tooltip: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.
true.description: Your account's AWS region that you will use to access AWS services.

true.title: Role ARN
true.name: role_arn
true.tooltip: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: ARN of the role that you want to assume to execute this action on AWS.

true.title: Session Name
true.name: session_name
true.tooltip: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.
true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Firewall ARN
parameters.name: FirewallArn
parameters.tooltip: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the firewall. You must specify the ARN of the firewall or the name of the firewall, or you can specify both the ARN and the name of the firewall. Note: Length Constraints: The minimum length is set as 1, and the maximum length is set as 256.
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the firewall. You must specify the ARN of the firewall or the name of the firewall, or you can specify both the ARN and the name of the firewall. Note: Length Constraints: The minimum length is set as 1, and the maximum length is set as 256.

parameters.title: Firewall Name
parameters.name: FirewallName
parameters.tooltip: The descriptive name of the firewall. You cannot change the name of a firewall after its creation. You must specify the ARN of the firewall or the name of the firewall, or you can specify both the ARN and the name of the firewall.
parameters.description: The descriptive name of the firewall. You cannot change the name of a firewall after its creation. You must specify the ARN of the firewall or the name of the firewall, or you can specify both the ARN and the name of the firewall.

operations.title: Describe Firewall Policy
operations.description: Returns the data objects for the specified firewall policy from AWS Network Firewall.

parameters.title: Rule Group Name
parameters.name: RuleGroupName
parameters.tooltip: The descriptive name of the rule group. You cannot change the name of the rule group after its creation. This setting is required for requests that do not include the Rule Group ARN.
parameters.description: The descriptive name of the rule group. You cannot change the name of the rule group after its creation. This setting is required for requests that do not include the Rule Group ARN.

parameters.title: Rule Group ARN
parameters.name: RuleGroupArn
parameters.tooltip: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the rule group. You must specify the name or ARN of the rule group, or you can specify both the ARN and the name of the rule group.
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the rule group. You must specify the name or ARN of the rule group, or you can specify both the ARN and the name of the rule group.

parameters.title: Type
parameters.name: Type
parameters.tooltip: Select the type of rule group; you can choose between STATELESS OR STATEFUL. If the rule group is stateless, it contains stateless rules. If it is stateful, it contains stateful rules.
parameters.description: Select the type of rule group; you can choose between STATELESS OR STATEFUL. If the rule group is stateless, it contains stateless rules. If it is stateful, it contains stateful rules.

operations.title: Delete Firewall
operations.description: Deletes the specified Firewall and its FirewallStatus from AWS Network Firewall. This operation requires that the firewall's DeleteProtection flag is set to FALSE and you cannot revert this operation. Note: You can check whether a firewall is in use by reviewing the route tables for the Availability Zones where you have firewall subnet mappings. You can retrieve the subnet mappings by using the 'Describe Firewall' operation.

operations.title: Disassociate Subnets
operations.description: Removes the specified subnet associations from the firewall on AWS Network Firewall. This removes the firewall endpoints from the subnets and removes any network filtering protections that were provided by the endpoints.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to assume a role. Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the Configuration Type. If you have specified Access Credentials as the Configuration Type, then this parameter is optional.

parameters.title: Subnet IDs
parameters.name: SubnetIds
parameters.tooltip: Specify a CSV list of unique identifiers of the subnets that you want to disassociate from the specified firewall on AWS Network Firewall.
parameters.description: Specify a CSV list of unique identifiers of the subnets that you want to disassociate from the specified firewall on AWS Network Firewall.

parameters.title: Firewall ARN
parameters.name: FirewallArn
parameters.tooltip: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the firewall. You must specify the ARN of the firewall or the name of the firewall, or you can specify both the name and the ARN.

parameters.title: Firewall Name

parameters.description: The descriptive name of the firewall. You cannot change the name of a firewall after its creation. You must specify the ARN of the firewall or the name of the firewall, or you can specify both the name and the ARN.

parameters.title: Update Token
parameters.name: UpdateToken
parameters.tooltip: An optional token that you can use for optimistic locking. AWS Network Firewall returns a token to your requests that access the firewall. The token marks the state of the firewall resource at the time of the request.
parameters.description: An optional token that you can use for optimistic locking. AWS Network Firewall returns a token to your requests that access the firewall. The token marks the state of the firewall resource at the time of the request.

operations.title: Tag Resource
operations.description: Adds the specified tags to the specified resource.

parameters.title: Assume a Role
parameters.name: assume_role
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to assume a role. Note: You must enable this option, i.e., this parameter is required, if you have specified IAM Role as the Configuration Type. If you have specified Access Credentials as the Configuration Type, then this parameter is optional.

true.description: Name of the session that will be created to execute this action on AWS.

parameters.title: Resource ARN
parameters.name: ResourceArn
parameters.tooltip: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to tag in AWS Network Firewall.
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource that you want to tag in AWS Network Firewall.

parameters.title: Tags
parameters.name: Tags
parameters.tooltip: An array of tag objects to associate with the resource.  Note: The minimum number of items that are supported in an array is 1 and the maximum number of items that are supported in an array is 200.
parameters.description: An array of tag objects to associate with the resource.  Note: The minimum number of items that are supported in an array is 1 and the maximum number of items that are supported in an array is 200.

parameters.title: Next Token
parameters.name: NextToken
parameters.tooltip: When you request a list of objects with a MaxResults setting, if the number of objects that are still available for retrieval exceeds the maximum you requested, AWS Network Firewall returns a NextToken value in the response. To retrieve the next batch of objects, use the token returned from the prior request in your next request.
parameters.description: (Optional) When you request a list of objects with a MaxResults setting, if the number of objects that are still available for retrieval exceeds the maximum you requested, AWS Network Firewall returns a NextToken value in the response. To retrieve the next batch of objects, use the token returned from the prior request in your next request.
